com.authlete.cose

Class SigStructureBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.authlete.cose.SigStructureBuilder

  • public class SigStructureBuilder
extends Object
    A utility to build a SigStructure instance.

    The SigStructure class represents Sig_structure which is defined in 4.4. Signing and Verification Process of RFC 9052 as follows. 

     Sig_structure = [
     context : "Signature" / "Signature1",
     body_protected : empty_or_serialized_map,
     ? sign_protected : empty_or_serialized_map,
     external_aad : bstr,
     payload : bstr
 ]
    Since:
    1.1
    See Also:
    RFC 9052, 4.4. Signing and Verification Process, SigStructure

      • sign

        public SigStructureBuilder sign(COSESign sign)
        Set some fields of Sig_structure based on the given COSESign object that represents COSE_Sign which is defined in 4.1. Signing with One or More Signers of RFC 9052.

        The implementation of this method does the following.

        1. Set "Signature" to Sig_structure.context.
        2. Set sign.getProtectedeHeader() to Sig_structure.body_protected.
        3. Set sign.getPayload() to Sig_sructure.payload if the payload is not null and not a CBORNull instance.
        Parameters:
        sign - A COSESign object that represents COSE_Sign.
        Returns:
        this object.
        See Also:
        RFC 9052, 4.1. Signing with One or More Signers

      • signature

        public SigStructureBuilder signature(COSESignature signature)
        Set the protected header of the given COSESignature object to Sig_structure.sign_protected.

        The COSESignature class represents COSE_Signature which is defined in 4.1. Signing with One or More Signers of RFC 9052.

        Parameters:
        signature - A COSESignature object that represents COSE_Signature.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • sign1

        public SigStructureBuilder sign1(COSESign1 sign1)
        Set some fields of Sig_structure based on the given COSESign1 object that represents COSE_Sign1 which is defined in 4.2. Signing with One Signer of RFC 9052.

        The implementation of this method does the following.

        1. Set "Signature1" to Sig_structure.context.
        2. Set sign1.getProtectedeHeader() to Sig_structure.body_protected.
        3. Set sign1.getPayload() to Sig_sructure.payload if the payload is not null and not a CBORNull instance.
        Parameters:
        sign1 - A COSESign1 object that represents COSE_Sign1.
        Returns:
        this object.
        See Also:
        RFC 9052, 4.2. Signing with One Signer

      • build

        public SigStructure build()
                   throws IllegalStateException
        Build a SigStructure instance that represents Sig_structure.

        For this method to return a SigStructure instance successfully, the following must be satisfied.

        1. signature(), signature1(), sign(COSESign), or sign1(COSESign1) must have been called to set Sig_structure.context.
        2. payload(CBORByteArray), sign(COSESign) or sign1(COSESign1) must have been called to set Sig_structure.payload.
        Returns:
        A newly created SigStructure instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException
